event_description: Apple reported strong Q2 2025 financial results, with revenue reaching $95.4 billion, a 5% year-over-year increase, and diluted EPS of $1.65, up 8% year-over-year. Services revenue achieved a record high of $26.6 billion, growing 12% year-over-year, supported by over 1 billion paid subscriptions. [1, 3, 5, 8]

Apple anticipates a $900 million impact on costs in the June quarter due to tariffs. [1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8] This comes amidst renewed US-China trade tensions and concerns about Apple's reliance on China for both sales and production. [2, 6]
